title: forge debug bug on default example
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (bdea91c 2023-09-26T15:42:16.349668000Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge test

### Operating System

macOS (Apple Silicon)

### Describe the bug

The bug occured when trying debug functionality on hello world example. 

# Setup

```forge``` is installed using ```foundryup```, which was installed as described in [installation section](https://book.getfoundry.sh/getting-started/installation) for mac.

Project was initiated via:
```bash
forge init bug-test 
```

# Reproduction

To reproduce the bug:
```bash
cd bug-test
forge test --debug "test_Increment()"
```

Received output:
```bash
[⠒] Compiling...
[⠢] Compiling 22 files with 0.8.21
[⠔] Solc 0.8.21 finished in 2.12s
Compiler run successful!
The application panicked (crashed).
Message:  We should have collected debug information
Location: crates/debugger/src/debugger.rs:29

This is a bug. Consider reporting it at https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry

Backtrace omitted. Run with RUST_BACKTRACE=1 environment variable to display it.
Run with RUST_BACKTRACE=full to include source snippets.
zsh: abort      forge test --debug "test_Increment()"
```

Output with ```RUST_BACKTRACE=1```:
```bash
[⠢] Compiling...
No files changed, compilation skipped
The application panicked (crashed).
Message:  We should have collected debug information
Location: crates/debugger/src/debugger.rs:29

This is a bug. Consider reporting it at https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry

  ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━ BACKTRACE ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
   1: __mh_execute_header<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
   2: __mh_execute_header<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
   3: __mh_execute_header<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
   4: __mh_execute_header<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
   5: __mh_execute_header<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
   6: __mh_execute_header<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
   7: __mh_execute_header<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
   8: __mh_execute_header<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
   9: __mh_execute_header<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
  10: __mh_execute_header<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
  11: __mh_execute_header<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
  12: __mh_execute_header<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
  13: __mh_execute_header<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
  14: __mh_execute_header<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
  15: __mh_execute_header<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
  16: __mh_execute_header<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>

Run with COLORBT_SHOW_HIDDEN=1 environment variable to disable frame filtering.
Run with RUST_BACKTRACE=full to include source snippets.
zsh: abort      RUST_BACKTRACE=1 forge test --debug "test_Increment()"
``` 

Will be glad to provide any additional info required.
cc @iFrostizz any chance we can split the open pr that i think fixes this and get this done? we have very low internal bandwith rn to get to this soon
